exercises.title: Track Your Thoughts
exercises.description: Record negative thoughts related to addiction. Answer one of the questions provided.
prompts: What thoughts or beliefs led to this feeling?
What triggered these feelings or thoughts?
What is the outcome of these thoughts?

exercises.title: Challenging Negative Thoughts
exercises.description: Identify a negative thought and use one of the prompts to challenge it.
prompts: What evidence do I have that supports or contradicts this thought?
If a friend had this thought, what would I tell them?
What would happen if I viewed this thought differently?

fields.name: Alternative Thought
fields.label: What alternative thought could replace it?

exercises.title: Coping Strategies
exercises.description: List coping strategies for managing difficult emotions.
prompts: What are three activities that help you calm down?
What supportive person could you reach out to when stressed?
What self-care actions can help you manage tough emotions?

exercises.title: Grounding Exercise
exercises.description: Use a grounding exercise to stay present in the moment.
prompts: Describe your surroundings. What do you see and hear?
List five things you can see, four things you can touch, three things you hear, two things you smell, and one thing you taste.
Take a few deep breaths and observe your body sensations. How does your body feel?

exercises.title: Body Scan Meditation
exercises.description: Practice a body scan to observe any tension or sensations.
prompts: Start from your head and move down to your toes. Where do you feel tension?
What areas of your body feel relaxed?
Is there a part of your body that feels discomfort? Focus on that area and try to release it.

exercises.title: Breathing Exercise
exercises.description: Practice focused breathing to calm your mind.
prompts: Take five deep breaths. How do you feel afterward?
Focus on your breath for one minute. What sensations do you notice?
Breathe slowly and count each inhale and exhale. What thoughts come up as you do this?

fields.name: Before Exercise
fields.label: Describe how you felt before starting.

fields.name: Thoughts
fields.label: What thoughts came up during the exercise?

exercises.title: Identify Risk Factors
exercises.description: Place a check mark beside risk factors you have experienced.

fields.name: Family History of Addiction
fields.label: Do you have a family history of addiction?

fields.name: Mental Health Issues
fields.label: Have you experienced mental health issues?

fields.name: Early Exposure to Substances
fields.label: Were you exposed to substances at a young age?

fields.name: Traumatic Experiences
fields.label: Have you experienced trauma in your life?

fields.name: High-Stress Environment
fields.label: Did you grow up in a high-stress environment?

exercises.title: Personal Strengths
exercises.description: Identify your strengths that can help in recovery.
prompts: What personal qualities can help you stay strong in recovery?
What is something you’ve achieved that you’re proud of?
Who in your life supports you positively?
